member.name: P:neolibs.Dialogs.AboutBox.AppEntryAssembly
member.summary: returns the entry assembly for the current application domain
member.remarks: This is usually read-only, but in some weird cases (Smart Client apps) you won't have an entry assembly, so you may want to set this manually.

member.name: P:neolibs.Dialogs.AboutBox.AppCopyright
member.summary: single line of text to show in the copyright section of the about dialog

member.name: P:neolibs.Dialogs.AboutBox.AppImage
member.summary: intended for the default 32x32 application icon to appear in the upper left of the about dialog
member.remarks: if you open this form using .ShowDialog(Owner), the icon can be derived from the owning form

member.name: P:neolibs.Dialogs.AboutBox.AppMoreInfo
member.summary: multiple lines of miscellaneous text to show in rich text box

member.name: M:neolibs.Scanning.Scanner.Scan(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Scan memics scanf. A master regular expression pattern is created that will group each "word" in the text and using regex grouping extract the values for the field specifications. Example text: "Hello true 6.5" fieldSpecification: "{String} {Boolean} {Double}" The fieldSpecification will result in the generation of a master Pattern: ([\w\d\S]+)\s+(true|false)\s+([-]|[.]|[-.]|[0-9][0-9]*[.]*[0-9]+) This masterPattern is ran against the text string and the groups are extracted.
member.param: A string that may contain simple field specifications of the form {Int16}, {String}, etc
member.returns: object[] that contains values for each field

members.member: Scan memics scanf. A master regular expression pattern is created that will group each "word" in the text and using regex grouping extract the values for the field specifications. Example text: "Hello true 6.5" fieldSpecification: "{0} {1} {2}" and the target array has objects of these types: "String, ,Boolean, Double" The targets are scanned and each target type is extracted in order to build a master pattern based on these types The fieldSpecification and target types will result in the generation of a master Pattern: ([\w\d\S]+)\s+(true|false)\s+([-]|[.]|[-.]|[0-9][0-9]*[.]*[0-9]+) This masterPattern is ran against the text string and the groups are extracted and placed back into the targets

member.name: M:neolibs.Scanning.Scanner.ReturnValue(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Return the Value inside of an object that boxes the built in type or references the string

member.summary: Return a pattern for regular expressions that will match the built in type specified by name
